meanings.definition: Authorized or generally accepted theory, doctrine, or practice
meanings.sent1: The community followed the orthodoxy of their leader's teachings.
meanings.sent2: The priest preached the importance of orthodoxy in their faith.
meanings.sent3: The debate club's orthodoxy was to always argue with humor.
meanings.sent4: Her orthodoxy in science made her a reliable source of information.
meanings.sent5: The orthodoxy of the law was evident in every courtroom.

meanings.definition: Adherence to traditional or established beliefs, especially in religion
meanings.sent1: His family's orthodoxy meant they celebrated the same holidays every year.
meanings.sent2: The village's orthodoxy was to attend church every Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The orthodoxy of always wearing matching socks amused her friends.
meanings.sent4: Her orthodoxy to her grandmother's recipes made her a great cook.
meanings.sent5: The orthodoxy of superstitions was deeply ingrained in their culture.

meanings.definition: Conforming to the usual beliefs or established doctrines, especially in religion
meanings.sent1: The orthodoxy view was shared by most members of the congregation.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated his orthodoxy approach to their customs.
meanings.sent3: The orthodoxy cupcakes at the bake sale were a hit.
meanings.sent4: His orthodoxy dedication to his craft was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The orthodoxy traditions were passed down for generations.
